intro.description: Model validation enables the verification of a certain set of rules. Besides the standard UML rules, RobotML defines a dozen of additional rules, for instance a validation of the typing rules for ports.

item.title: Verify validation settings
item.description: Verify the validation settings, i.e. the currently active validation rules (constraints). Open the entry "Model Validation" within Window/Preferences and verify the active constraints. RobotML related constraints are grouped.

item.title: Validate your Model
item.description: Validate your model. Click right on an element within the model explorer. Choose the option "Validate model". Erroneous elements will appear in the Problem view, will be marked in the model explorer and in the diagrams. Caveat: the model explorer creates a visual marker for problems found within a child whereas this is not the case for diagrams.
